alert.note: Alert for Bureau; La Salle; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 10:23AM CST until February 28 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at La Salle affecting La Salle, Bureau and Putnam Counties. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Morris, Ottawa, La Salle...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River at La Salle. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, the lower parking lot at Starved Rock State Park is inundated east of La Salle. High water levels also begin to impact shipping interests along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CST Tuesday was 20.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 430 AM CST late tonight.
